head.title: World Briefing | Australia: 3 Scientists Cite Pressure Over Global Warming

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Australia: 3 Scientists Cite Pressure Over Global Warming

block.p: Three scientists who have studied climate change for a state science agency said the Australian government had intimidated them over their views, The Sydney Morning Herald and other newspapers reported. Graeme Pearman, left, the former director of atmospheric research at the Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organization, Australia's main science agency, said he had been reprimanded after backing a call for action to reduce greenhouse gases. Two other scientists, Barrie Pittock and Barney Foran, said they had been barred from disseminating some scientific information. The agency's deputy chief executive, Ron Sandland, said it prohibited its scientists from commenting on policy.
